title: Siya Mdaka
text:
Siyabulela Mdaka (born 14 February 1988 in Mthatha) is a South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who last played for the <a href="Leopards%20%28rugby%20union%29">Leopards (rugby union)</a> in the <a href="Currie%20Cup">Currie Cup</a> and in the <a href="Rugby%20Challenge%20%28South%20Africa%29">Rugby Challenge</a>. His regular position is flanker.
Career.
Youth and Varsity rugby.
He played for Border Country Districts at the 2004 Under-16 Grant Khomo Week competition before moving to <a href="Durban">Durban</a>, where he played for Natal at the 2006 Under-18 Academy Week tournament. He progressed through the academy system and played for the side in 2007 and the side in 2008 and 2009.
In 2010, he moved to <a href="Potchefstroom">Potchefstroom</a>, where he represented local university side in the <a href="Varsity%20Cup">Varsity Cup</a> competition in <a href="2010%20Varsity%20Cup">2010</a>, <a href="2011%20Varsity%20Cup">2011</a> and <a href="2012%20Varsity%20Rugby%23Varsity%20Cup">2012</a>, making twenty appearances in total.
Leopards.
During his spell in Potchefstroom, he also made his first class debut for the . He was included in their squad for the <a href="2011%20Currie%20Cup%20Premier%20Division">2011 Currie Cup Premier Division</a> competition and made his debut by starting their match against the at the <a href="Royal%20Bafokeng%20Stadium">Royal Bafokeng Stadium</a>. He made one more start, as well as two substitute appearances during that competition.
Border Bulldogs.
After the conclusion of the <a href="2012%20Varsity%20Rugby%23Varsity%20Cup">2012 Varsity Cup</a> competition, Mdaka returned to the <a href="Eastern%20Cape">Eastern Cape</a> and joined First Division strugglers . He made three appearances for them during the <a href="2012%20Currie%20Cup%20First%20Division">2012 Currie Cup First Division</a> and was a regular in 2013, making six appearances in the <a href="2013%20Vodacom%20Cup">2013 Vodacom Cup</a> and twelve in the <a href="2013%20Currie%20Cup%20First%20Division">2013 Currie Cup First Division</a>.
